result.execSummary:
The defendant William D Kletsch was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. William D Kletsch is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • William D Kletsch was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. William D Kletsch

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Restitution Claim Form filed. None requested.

Cases called: 15CM174, 15CM228, 15CM229 & 15CM382, Defendant William D Kletsch in court with attorney Amanda K. Riek.  Christine M. Genda appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Discussion held regarding victim impact statement. Court proceeded with hearing. Court went over the rights & elements. Defendant pled no contest to count 2 in 15CM174 (ct. 1 dismissed) and count 1 in 15CM229 (ct. 2 dismissed). Court found defendant guilty, entered judgment, sentence. In 15CM174, Court sentenced defendant to 6 days jail, 5 days jail credit for time served. $543 costs.  In 15M299, Court imposed $743 fine,  60 days to pay fine or set up a payment plan with Clerk of Courts.  Posted cash bond applied to fine/cost. 15CM228 & 15CM382 dismissed.
from Atty Riek requesting plea/sentencing hearing be scheduled

Scheduling Order for the November 5, 2015 jury trial.

Attorney Amanda K. Riek appeared. Jane E. Kohlwey appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Cases filed: 15CM174, 15CM228, & 15CM229.  Authorization to appear was filed for 15CM228 & 15CM229.  Not guilty plea entered.  Court entered not guilty plea, jury trial to be set. Bond continued.
